cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 85 miles SSW of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Slow westward drift, then turning northwest and north toward the central Louisiana coast and inland up the lower Mississippi Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Intracoastal City–Morgan City

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch from Shell Beach LA to the MS/AL border; Tropical Storm Watch east of the Pearl River MS to the MS/AL border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Intracoastal City to Grand Isle LA; Tropical Storm Warning mouth of the Pearl River to Grand Isle LA and Intracoastal City to Cameron LA; Storm Surge Warning Intracoastal City to Shell Beach LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from the Upper Texas coast through Louisiana to the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Gusty tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph) possible Saturday as outer bands reach southeast Texas
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge inundation expected along the Port Arthur area (predicted <3 ft)
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring 4–6 inches of rain with locally higher amounts, producing localized flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible in outer rain bands; brief visibility reductions and lightning could disrupt terminal/berth operations
